newsitem.title: GERMANY: ICO to help market explore coffee demand potential.
newsitem.headline: ICO to help market explore coffee demand potential.

text.p: The International Coffee Organization (ICO) will assist the market in exploring new centres of consumption and in creating niches in existing ones, ICO Executive Director Celsius Lodder said on Tuesday.

"My view is that the ICO has to remain flexible, should seek the widest possible consensus and must build upon the co-operation that we have achieved with trade experts," said Lodder, who was addressing a two-day F.O. Licht World Coffee conference.
"You can expect a proactive, analytical and flexible approach from the Organization."
The ICO would help promote quality coffee through a special Gourmet coffee project and, on the production side, it was pooling research findings on combatting the coffee berry borer.
Outside the established markets, the ICO had a vision of coffee becoming the predominant beverage in developing country markets as well, which would secure future sales.
Lodder said the ICO was aware the coffee market was increasingly dependent on risk management as trade participants and consumers reduced stocks in the wake of the 1994 price explosion.
As a result, the private sector at origin needed to hold more stocks and this was adding to their costs.

The ICO needed to address ensuing problems -- coffee being stored in remote areas and in unsuitable warehouses as consumers, for the time being, appeared unlikely to abandon their just-in-time strategy.
Lodder in a quesiton-and-answer session said it was unlikely the U.S., which pulled out of the 55-member ICO in 1993, would return.
